doc.field: The John Lundin papers contain correspondence exchanged during World War II and a publication, "Across the Brooklyn Bridge" by Lundin's son, John Eric Lundin. These letters reveal Lundin's experience as a World War II soldier. John E. Lundin's "Across the Brooklyn Bridge" retells Lundin family history, including details about Lundin's experience as a World War II soldier and an engineering student at the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn (now renamed NYU Tandon School of Engineering).

The John Lundin papers contain correspondence and a publication. Contents include: Several letters exchanged between 1943-1945 and a book, titled "Across the Brooklyn Bridge" by Lundin's son, John Eric Lundin. The collection is 1 linear foot, located on bay 29, shelf 7E.
The collection was donated by John E. Lundin, son of John Lundin, in May 2021.
